title: danieleither
author: danieleither
content: Posting purely for informative reasons, however it appears that Bitmain are still churning out crap.I have just received a delivery of 12 x new S19 Pro (110T) from Bitmain, and within 2 hours of commissioning, I have 3 x dead hashboards (across 3 x miners) with 0 asics. They are clearly not giving a proper soak test. I realise of course they will exchange on warranty, but it's so much hassle as you have to return the complete unit (compared to Whatsminer for example, who will let you return a faulty hashboard on its own).

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: I think it is due to delivery sometimes they don't handle them with care.If you are far and shipping is expensive it would be better to repair it on your own.How about trying to do some basic things first like upgrading the firmware of your 3 units to the latest version?If it still doesn't work try to replug all cables of these 3 units and test it again.

comments.author: Sledge0001
comments.body: The other part that is brutal is that Bitmain can take months to actually return the dead units after sending it in for warranty repair.They've kinda unknowingly changed the meaning of silicon lottery...

comments.author: philipma1957
comments.body: Quote from: danieleither on July 01, 2023, 12:06:18 PMPosting purely for informative reasons, however it appears that Bitmain are still churning out crap.I have just received a delivery of 12 x new S19 Pro (110T) from Bitmain, and within 2 hours of commissioning, I have 3 x dead hashboards (across 3 x miners) with 0 asics. They are clearly not giving a proper soak test. I realise of course they will exchange on warranty, but it's so much hassle as you have to return the complete unit (compared to Whatsminer for example, who will let you return a faulty hashboard on its own). I am using vms they are in Long Island NY. IIRC you are in the general area of NY.https://vmssecuritycloud.comTh owner is named GREG if you contact him for repair tell him I sent you.

comments.author: Nexus9090
comments.body: Quote from: danieleither on July 01, 2023, 12:06:18 PMPosting purely for informative reasons, however it appears that Bitmain are still churning out crap.I have just received a delivery of 12 x new S19 Pro (110T) from Bitmain, and within 2 hours of commissioning, I have 3 x dead hashboards (across 3 x miners) with 0 asics. They are clearly not giving a proper soak test. I realise of course they will exchange on warranty, but it's so much hassle as you have to return the complete unit (compared to Whatsminer for example, who will let you return a faulty hashboard on its own). Speaking from very limited experience, the couple of S17 boards I've seen and repaired the solder quality was appalling. I expect the S19 are of similar quality. With a few thermal cycles and transportation vibration I'm hardly surprised that they end up failing.I think they must use OSP on their bare boards before reflow it leaves a nasty resedue if not reflowed properly, leading to weak solder joints. All the fixes I've done were achieved through reflow/resoldering of the suspect ASIC's, on the S17 the hardest part was removing the heatsinks without damaging anything else. I think the S19 uses a different heatsink strategy, so might be easier to rework.I don't think quality control for soldering is their expertise.
